MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Recap of Episode 2. Fussen, a noblewoman from Eisengrad, picks up a mysterious child and by chance we decide to take care of him together.

Even after that, we still don't know the identity of the mysterious toddler. Conductor II (we have to call him that because "Conductor" alone is confusing) is basically a good, quiet boy― he doesn't say anything meaningful, but he doesn't bother us either.

I am also slightly worried about leaving the child alone with Fussen, so I decide to borrow a room in her house and stay there for a while. While taking care of the child in this way, I will also take measures such as requesting my subordinates in the SSS to investigate.

Fortunately, it is a peaceful time and there are no expeditionary missions. While doing paperwork and other desk work, I spend breakfast, lunch, and dinner with Fussen and the child. We eat together, talk together, and share time together.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmm. It's like we're newlyweds.
Fussen seems to be pleased with the situation. I have become accustomed to such a strange life, and gradually I start to feel that Fussen and the child are like family to me.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I think this is what they call a reunion. I was separated from my parents when I was a child and imprisoned half of my life in this castle, so this is the first time I've experienced something like this, and I feel tingly and fresh.

It's the same for me. My father died when I was very young, and my mother, who was always away doing research, disappeared. I was lonely for a long time, and I think I was looking for a family somewhere in my heart.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmm. We're a lot alike, aren't we? No matter how many pets, slaves, gold, silver, treasures, and artifacts I collect, I will never be satisfied. I've...always wanted a family.

In the midst of this strange life, I have conversations like this with Fussen. The more time we spend together, the more we seem to have grown attached to each other, she becomes less rugged than before, and I become less afraid of the noblewoman in a good way.

It might be good for the three of us to live together like this forever...
I've been thinking about it for a while now.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: ...Conductor

One day, I am approached by a heavy-hearted Fussen. At that time, I was giving the child a bath in the bathhouse in the castle. He can't wash himself yet, and he's at an age when you can't let him out of your sight.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Cinderella―my family's cold-blooded lizard slave―
has come clean about everything!

Fussen holds up a ragged, pure white dragon―
Cinderella, who has served Fussen's family since ancient times―and speaks crisply.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I heard it was all a trick of hers.
...That means?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I don't know how to explain it...I'm a descendant of a noble family with noble blood, so there's no end to the number of matchmaking offers I get. I understand that marriage is necessary to pass on the Ancient Great Blood to future generations, but I've never been comfortable with the idea.
Fussen blurts out, looking at me with clinging eyes.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: But not long ago...a certain nobleman, whose family is of a higher rank than mine, made me an offer of marriage.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
It's not something I can refuse. If I do that, I'll lose my standing in aristocratic society.
In the worst case, my family may be destroyed.
It's hard to imagine how frightening that would be for her, who is always proud of her blood and lives proudly as a noblewoman. As a commoner, it's hard for me to even imagine.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: But I have no intention of being united with anyone yet. It seems that this fucking lizard has taken my feelings as a master into consideration and has taken unnecessary care of me.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Your language is not gracious, Lady Fussen.

Cinderella responds rather unconcernedly, though she has probably been beaten to shreds by the whip. This beautiful dragon, which seems to be immortal in principle, does not seem to be affected much even if it receives this kind of treatment.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
I am not a lizard, to begin with.
I am a descendant of the dragons that ruled the earth before the apes like you took over.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: It doesn't matter. Blood is important, but what is more important is how you use the life you have been given. Don't you feel ashamed of yourself for doing such a foolish thing?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I have no words to reply.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: ...Conductor. She had a plan to ruin my marriage proposal. First of all, I heard that she found a valuable monster from somewhere that can transform into any form.
...So that means?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Hmm. Our lovely Conductor II is that monster.
How many times have we both thought that he looks like our own child?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: That was the point. A secret agent from the other side who came to investigate secretly before the arranged marriage witnessed us living together as if we were newlyweds.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: They reported it to their Lord. The great aristocrats who value the richness of their blood would probably dismiss the idea of an arranged marriage themselves. They don't want the blood of the common people to be mixed in with their glittering family trees, even by any chance.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Cinderella
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Or rather. The mere fact that the young lady he has his eye on as a marriage partner has a lover of some sort is enough to make him shy away. Because scandals are something that a nobleman should avoid above all else.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmm. In the neighboring country of Verforet, there is a nobleman who went bankrupt due to a scandal a long time ago. Even Blanche from the SSS said that a certain big shot had lost everything because of a commoner child.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Fearing that kind of thing, the other party will back off. In the near future, I'm sure I'll get a call from someone saying that the matchmaking talks never happened. They're going to get caught up in the evil lizard's scheme, give up on their own, and lose interest in me.

Should I say...that's too bad?
Your opportunity to become a member of the great aristocracy has been wiped out, hasn't it?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Don't be mean. This was for the best, Conductor. There should be no such thing as an unwanted marriage. Husbands and wives should love each other, seek each other out, and bear each other's precious children.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
In aristocratic society, such things as political marriages are not uncommon.
But times have changed, and I resent the fact that the snobs are acting like they own the world.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I'm glad this happened.
I see. Then we won't say anything either.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
Hmm. The other side, the great aristocracy, would not be so shameless as to spread ugly news, and what they learned is not true, so it can be excused.
I have not lost anything. Laugh it up, Conductor.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I will laugh, too. As always, I'll give you a good laugh as a noblewoman. In fact, isn't it painful...? If being able to impose one's will is a sign of nobility, then I have become a noblewoman who surpasses the greatest noble in Eisengrad.

Well, that's the most important thing. What are you going to do about the child?
Don't tell me you're going to get rid of him because he's no longer useful?

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: Hmm. Do you think that I am a brutal tyrant, Papa...? Mist Monsters poisoned by Phantom Mist are indefensible targets for extermination, but fortunately this one seems to be an indigenous demon with a beautiful body.
Gently picking up the child, Fussen rubs his cheeks lovingly.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I will protect him raise him with care. When he grows up, I will dress him up as a butler and let him serve me. You should be honored, Child.

The child, who seems to be unable to understand our language, is puzzled...
Fussen's affection for him is evident, and he embraces her with a somewhat happy look.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase:
My dear child, you will grow up well. I will make you into a fine gentleman,
not a political tool, who will make the sun shine on your heart.

MSceneDetailViewModel.Name: Fussen
MSceneDetailViewModel.Phrase: I'll love you forever...I've got you, my family.
With that, Fussen smiles nobly.
